arm_group.description: cardiopulmonary bypass with maintenance of normal body temperature

brief_summary.textblock:
The aim of our study was to evaluate the effect of different temperature regimens of
      cardiopulmonary bypass on systemic oxygen transport and cerebral oxygenation during surgical
      correction of acquired heart diseases.

clinical_study.brief_title: Normothermiс Cardiopulmonary Bypass Increases Cerebral Oxygenation During Valve Surgery

detailed_description.textblock:
Our aim was to evaluate the effect of hypothermic and normothermic regimens of
      cardiopulmonary bypass on systemic oxygen transport and cerebral oxygenation during valve
      surgery

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  requirement of surgical correction of two or more valves

intervention.description: maintenance of mild hypothermia during cardiopulmonary bypass
maintenance of normal body temperature during cardiopulmonary bypass

clinical_study.official_title: Normothermiс Cardiopulmonary Bypass Increases Cerebral Oxygenation During Combined Valve Surgery: Single Center, Randomized Trial

oversight_info.authority: Russia: Ministry of Health of the Russian Federation

primary_outcome.description: measurement of cerebral oxygen saturation during cardiopulmonary bypass and 24 hrs postoperatively

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.description: measurement of time to fulfillment of the "fit for discharge" criteria
secondary_outcome.measure: time until "fit for ICU discharge" fulfillment

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Single Blind (Subject), Primary Purpose: Treatment
